channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 3 glass panes missing in pavement skylight (?), 12th November
item.description:
Set in the pavement, on the north side of Eldorado Road, is what looks like a skylight- multiple glass panes within metal framework. 3 panes are missing but partially obscured by fallen leaves. Someone in heels or with walking stick or frame could come a cropper.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Eldorado Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Previous repair breaking down again., 12th November
item.description:
Previous job ref : 6563686 I think this has already been recently highlighted by a member of the public, but this recently repaired patch is breaking down again. Location is under the pedestrian overpass bridge, leading to the C&G roundabout, Glos. I see there are road works scheduled Dec 4-5th, so this might cover it ? Otherwise, can you survey it and repair it again please ? Thankyou !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Corinium Avenue, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic cones and barriers erected 10 days ago in the middle of a busy junction and left untouched, 12th November
item.description:
The pothole is in a very awkard place for drivers to navigate around and is causing confusion. The cones and barriers were erecreted around it 10 days ago and there have been action taken since then. The location is the A46 Shurdington road Moorend Park road traffic light junction. This should be resolved urgently before an accident occurs.,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorend Park Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath collapsed down bank, dangerous, 12th November
item.description:
Next to Ivy Cottage the footpath has collapsed down the bank and is dangerous to use. The adjacent driveway should not be used as alternative because a sign explicitly requests people to stick to the footpath. The footpath needs to be repaired.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights are to fast, 12th November
item.description:
The traffic lights on dunalley street do not stay green long enough, you can get a maximum of 3 cars out of the road before it turns red again, this could cause issues as i have witnessed cars going through after it has changed to red
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dunalley Street, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: The road surface condition of the entire Gloucester Road is an absolute disgrace. It is one of the main road in and out Cheltenham. It must be resurfaced ASAP, it is creating hazardous conditions as the drivers have to try and avoid the potholes. Not to mention the damages to the cars suspensions and wheels., 12th November
item.description:
Along the entire road from the station to the traffic lights at st georges road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 184, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rush hour traffic increase due to diversion, 12th November
item.description:
At the cold pool lane junction into Grovefield way & cold pool lane main road continuation. Due to the bridge closure on badgeworth lane, all traffic has been diverted into cold pool lane going into Cheltenham causing a huge congestion for villiagers that live in Badgeworth and beyond. The current wait time from 7.30 ish to just get to the end of cold pool lane from Badgeworth lane is well over 30 minutes due to the fact that they is no priority when joining the Grovefield way - cold pool lane main road. Please can temporary traffic lights be erected at the junction to help ease congestion, giving everyone an equal run of getting to where they need to go whilst the road closure is in place, and make everyoneâ€™s life a lot less stressful in the mornings. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cold Pool Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: SUGGESTION : To add an arrowed lane control sign ?, 12th November
item.description:
Hello, would you consider *adding* an arrowed lane control sign on Kayte lane, approaching GE traffic lights, from Southam ? The approach lane splits into two lanes, with the left lane **only going left**, and with the painted lane control arrows fairly close to the lights, and of there's traffic queueing and obscuring them, it's very difficult / impossible to determine which lane to be in on approach. As a driving instructor, I'd teach 'default left to go ahead', but in this case it only goes left. Like Gloucester Road (Dean Close School), there are two 'left only' signs on approach where the road lanes split. Many thanks ! Nat (Churchdown driving instructor)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southam Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 12th November
item.description:
Please see the photo of what appears to be a developing sinkhole on Corndean Lane near Winchcombe. Other than the telegraph poles, there are few features or landmarks on this section of road, but I believe the defect is in the section of map shown. Towards the top of the first steep section of road. It is on the left as one ascends the hill.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The 30 signs on Quat Goose Lane are discoloured and no longer visible, 12th November
item.description:
The 30 signs in two locations on Quat Goose Lane, one before The Firs and one after Brockhampton Lane are so old they no longer are visible at night. The village struggles with speeding cars and having replacement signs may help this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Quat Goose Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
